description: First and second floor level extensions to accommodate total of 3 x self-contained flats by creating flat at rear of ground floor level (following reduction in size of ground floor retail unit), increasing size of flat at first floor level and creating flat at second floor level including associated external terraces, car parking, refuse storage and cycle storage provision; and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope
decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of its scale, bulk, height, design and appearance would represent an overdevelopment of the site to the detriment of the character of the area, and the siting of the first floor level external amenity space would detrimentally impact the adjoining residential flat at No. 16 Boston Parade by way of increased overlooking and loss of privacy.  As such, the proposal would be contrary to policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The proposed development by way of scale, design, compromised head height with reduced floor to ceiling heights for the second floor flat, limited outlook with roof lights to serve the kitchen and bed area for the second floor flat,  reduced privacy and increased overlooking and minimal light for the ground floor flat with window openings adjacent communal areas and within close proximity to the adjacent buildings would result in sub-standard living conditions for future occupants. As such, the proposal is contrary to policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); the National Planning Policy Framework (2019); and the Technical Housing Standards - Nationally Described Space Standards.
